listing.title: Front End Web Developer
listing.description:
Description

The Metropolitan Area Planning Council (a public sector agency in Boston, MA) seeks a Front End Web Developer to design and construct user interfaces for web applications and digital tools intended to help create a more sustainable and equitable region. This position is part of our Digital Services team, a group with a diverse portfolio of successful products (https://www.mapc.org/learn/data-tools/) designed to engage diverse stakeholders, visualize complex information, improve planning processes, and modernize municipal operations. The topics we address include housing, transportation, public health, social equity, clean energy, economic development, and many other issues of concern to the region's communities.

In this position, you will work in a collaborative, respectful environment using modern web technologies and open source frameworks. This position is part of MAPC's Data Services Department, a team of planners, analysts, researchers, programmers, and IT professionals dedicated to using data and technology to support informed decision-making.

As MAPC's front end developer, you will contribute front end design and development to new and improved web applications for internal and external clients. As part of a small, interdisciplinary group, you will be involved in all aspects of the product delivery cycle and will have the opportunity to engage directly with partners and clients to develop valuable relationships with municipal planners, government officials, community members, and other technologists. You will have opportunities to learn and develop your skills in software development, user-centered product design, delivery, and deployment, and we offer many opportunities for professional development. To learn more about our work products, view our repository at github.com/mapc.
 

Examples of Duties

 

  • Design and build data-driven web services within a multidisciplinary team
  • Collaborate with government staff & municipal planning professionals to invent, implement, and deploy systems and improvements to existing technology.
  • Drive ideas from concept to production: from sketches & wireframing to implementation and production
  • Work with a multidisciplinary team to design and implement clear, accessible (A11Y) user interfaces for web applications using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript

 

Typical Qualifications

 

  • Experience designing consumer-facing web services for use by diverse audiences
  • Demonstrated proficiency with web markup, including HTML and CSS
  • Deep understanding of web and mobile user interface design and best practices
  • Proficient in JavaScript and familiar with front-end frameworks such as Ember or React
  • Experience with open-source version control, preferably using Git and GitHub
  • Experience with data visualization libraries such as d3.js
  • Experience working with geospatial data (geoJSON, Shapefiles) and geospatial software tools (Carto/Mapbox/Mapzen/Leaflet/PostGIS/QGIS/ArcMap)
  • Excellent written and oral communications skills
  • Experience with test-driven development or behavior-driven development practices is preferred
  • Experience refactoring legacy codebases and ability to iterate in working code is preferred
  • Experience designing and implementing web services/APIs is preferred
  • Demonstrated experience applying cartographic design principles to digital products is preferred
  • Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Technology, Interactive Design, Human Computer Interaction, Urban and Regional Planning, Urban Studies or a related field is preferred

 

Supplemental Information

Compensation
This is a full time exempt position.  The starting salary ranges from $65,000 to $75,000 annually depending on qualifications and experience. MAPC offers excellent Massachusetts state employee benefits as well as a flexible, supportive, and family-friendly work environment.

How to Apply
The position is open until filled, and applications are reviewed on a rolling basis. Interested candidates should submit a cover letter and resume.  Those who are interviewed will be asked to submit three (3) references plus a sample of relevant work products.
Apply online at www.mapc.org/jobs : Please attach a cover letter and resume.  In your resume, please include links to active (deployed) online projects, noting your role in producing them. If available, please provide a link to your GitHub (or similar) account, or attach samples of your code.
A review of applications will begin immediately.  The position is open until filled.  Candidates must have legal authorization to work in the USA and a valid driver's license and/or the ability to arrange transportation to meetings in different parts of the region.

MAPC is an EOE/AA employer. MAPC takes pride in the diversity of its workforce and encourages all qualified persons to apply.

company.name: Metropolitan Area Planning Council
company.tagline: Our mission is to promote smart growth and regional collaboration.

listing.title: UX Designer
listing.description:
The User Experience Designer is responsible for envisioning, designing, prototyping, and conducting research on user experiences for CFA Institute digital properties. This position works collaboratively with UX designers, front-end developers, and other core product team members to ensure delivery of a consistent and accessible experience to our global audiences.

The position is headquartered in Charlottesville, Virginia, USA and reports to the Manager, User Experience and Interactive Design.

 

Job Description:

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

  • Work collaboratively with product owners and development teams in a SAFe/Agile environment to create designs based on the latest web technologies, accessibility standards, and pattern libraries
  • Focus on user-centered design principles to create intuitive and highly functional and interactive designs
  • Simplify complex content and ideas into functional, usable interfaces 
  • Ensure existing UX guidelines and standards are followed during the development and maintenance of the product/site
  • Present design concepts and work with key stakeholders to arrive at designs that support business objectives, technological realities, and deliver a strong end-user experience
  • Initiate, plan, conduct, and/or participate in remote and/or in-person product usability testing
  • Communicate and work effectively with cross-functional team members including but not limited to developers, content writers, business owners/managers, project managers, other stakeholders
  • Translate low fidelity wireframes/UX prototypes into effective and appealing interfaces
  • Contribute to planning and stand-ups with product and development teams in an agile workflow
  • Proactively recognize UX/UI/accessibility gaps in designs and propose solutions
     

QUALIFICATIONS

  • B.S. degree or equivalent experience in interaction design, human-computer interaction, or related subject
  • A minimum of 3-5 years’ experience designing complex websites and applications
  • A solid understanding of WCAG and other accessibility design standards
  • Expertise in current trends and best practices for UX/UI design and data visualization
  • The ability to articulate user experience design issues effectively
  • A mastery of user-centered design principles and practices
  • The ability to quickly prototype designs in tools such as Sketch, InVision App, or Axure
  • Experience creating sitemaps, wireframes, and customer journeys
  • Innovative, creative problem-solving skills with an eye for detail and accuracy
  • Experience working in an agile development process
  • Excellent communication skills (oral, written, and listening)
  • Excellent organizational skills with proven ability to manage multiple concurrent projects and to adjust to frequent changes in project priorities
  • Knowledge of CSS, HTML, JavaScript (bonus)

 

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

  • Full time in office; Charlottesville, Virginia, USA

 

TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS

  • May require occasional travel to CFA Institute conferences, meetings, and other events

 

LEADERSHIP CAPABILITIES

  • Strategic – Connects ideas, resources and processes, with an outside-in perspective, to define winning solutions; employs a broad, global perspective and digital mindset to disrupt and transform
  • Courageous -- Actively listens, asks questions, develops an independent conclusion and is willing to challenge the popular view for the betterment of the organization
  • Authentic -- Reflects one’s true self in all situations; clearly says what they mean and does what they say they will do
  • Talent magnet -- Understands a candidate/employee’s capabilities and matches those to the appropriate role/assignment; seeks out diversity of thought and experience; invests in development; mentors and coaches for success; builds and rewards high functioning teams
  • Growth mindset -- Learns and grows through experimentation and failure; embraces challenges with persistence and resilience; demonstrates a willingness to risk failure and sees it as a key learning opportunity
  • Accountable -- Understands role and takes full ownership of their own, their team’s, and the organization’s success or failure; achieves efficient, timely, quality results through the effective leadership of others
  • Agile – Navigates complexity, challenges and ambiguity with confidence; creates an environment of learning to drive optimal outcomes; employs a continuous improvement mindset; encourages rapid, flexible response to change

 

This job description is a summary of job requirements and duties and is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all areas of responsibility.

 

Primary Location:

Charlottesville

listing.title: Front End Web Developer
listing.description:
The University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee is seeking to fill a full-time vacancy for a Front End Web Developer.

UW-Milwaukee is recognized as one of the country’s top research universities. With more than 190 academic programs, UWM offers a world class education to more than 25,000 students from more than 90 countries. UW-Milwaukee partners with businesses throughout the region, conducting joint research and offering
internships to students enrolled in its 14 schools and colleges. UWM’s 104-acre central campus is located on Milwaukee’s upper east side, one of the city’s most attractive residential areas and home to many faculty, staff, and students.

As the Front-end Web Developer at the University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee, you play an integral role building the UWM brand and supporting key university priorities and recruitment initiatives. Working collaboratively with the Integrated Marketing & Communication team and schools, colleges and departments, this position plays a primary role in the design and technical development of UWM.edu websites, campaign landing pages and other digital marketing components. The Front-end Web Developer brings the latest in industry trends to projects and processes and ensures that the highest quality of standards is met throughout every phase of the creative and production process. You leverage and champion organizational branding and implementation standards in your work and always strive to provide the best possible user-experience and information architecture for all site visitors and on all devices.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree by date of hire
  • Professional experience in front-end web development (i.e. HTML, CSS, JavaScript)

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Demonstrated proficiency in producing wireframes, design mockups and functional prototypes
  • Experience working with brand and implementation standards, such as design systems or pattern libraries
  • Experience with development for content management systems
  • Experience with version control systems, such as Git, and front-end build tools, such as Gulp or Webpack
  • Experience designing and developing highly usable websites through conventions such as accessibility compliance and taking a mobile-first approach
  • Demonstrated ability to work on a project independently and as part of a team consisting of multiple web developers/designers
  • Experience with user interaction tracking and Google Analytics
  • Experience working in a fast-paced environment that involves juggling multiple assignments and initiatives
  • Experience managing all aspects of a website project from initial planning to launch, including working directly with clients, managing scope and timeline, providing creative solutions to problems and working closely with other project team members
listing.perks:
UW- Milwaukee offers:

    Innovative, collaborative, and casual-work environment with flexible work/life balance schedules
    Challenging and progressive career development
    Competitive salary
    Excellent comprehensive benefits package
    On-site health & wellness programs
    On-site affordable day care
    Best practice PTO policies and paid holidays
    Open communication, recognition programs, and team-building events
listing.howto_apply:
Applicants should submit an application letter addressing the educational and professional qualifications above, a professional resume, and the names and contact information for three professional references. In addition, please provide a screen capture or link for each of the following: (1) your coding/development work, (2) your versioning repository commits from a recent project and short explanation of the project team roles, and (3) your design work.

For this position applicants are required to apply online. UWM will not consider paper, e-mailed or faxed applications.

In instances where the Search and Screen Committee is unable to ascertain from a candidateâ€™s application materials whether they meet any of the qualifications, they will be evaluated as not meeting such qualifications.

listing.title: Junior systems administrator
listing.description:
The junior systems administrator is part of the digital team that supports the marketing and development teams in developing, maintaining, and supporting HOPE’s CRM system as well as other marketing and technology tools, and organizational processes. This position serves internal users by responding to requests for support, reports, data imports, and other services at needed. The junior systems administrator participates as a member of the cross-functional CRM team with a goal of continually improving our marketing technology stack to better serve our constituents and internal users. This role also works closely with the IT group and the Salesforce Database Administrator to assist with systems upgrades, documentation, testing and validation, database clean-up and other operations as required. Additionally, this role assists in maintaining and improving data security and privacy practices and policies.

  • Salesforce
  • Support and contribute to management, maintenance, and upgrades of marketing technology stack
  • Assist with Salesforce database clean-up and organization
  • Contribute to planning, documenting, and executing new release testing and validation
  • Transition lead records to contacts records
  • Keep abreast of new Salesforce features and functionality and provide recommendations for process improvements‬‬‬‬
  • Marketing technology operations
  • Create documentation of procedures
  • Maintain quality service by establishing and enforcing organization standards
  • Monitor system performance and batch upload processes
  • Assist in processing and organizing of feedback and ideas in our product management software
  • Provide technical support Marketing Cloud functionality
  • Provide technical support for HOPE’s digital properties and website hosting
  • Support the marketing digital team on other core tasks as needed related to website, email, analytics, and digital promotions
  • Data security and privacy
  • Assist in on-going establishment and support of processes, policies, and monitoring of data security and privacy practices as it relates to constituent data
  • Learn and keep team aware of industry best practices and changing legislations
  •  
  •  

QUALIFICATIONS

  • Personal confession of Christian faith and commitment to the mission and vision of HOPE International
  • Critical thinker, active listener, and effective communicator (both written & verbal)
  • Dependable and flexible with the ability to work on multiple assignments as needed
  • 0 to 3 years Salesforce—or other cloud-based CRM platform—experience
  • Salesforce Administrator Certification required (may be obtained on the job)
  • Knowledge of marketing, fundraising, or financial operations and processes a plus
  • Understanding of relational databases and data integration tools
  • Experience with programming languages such as SQL, JavaScript, HTML, Java and Apex a plus
  • College degree or equivalent work or technical experience

 

  • Recent college grads are encouraged to apply
listing.perks: See https://www.hopeinternational.org/take-action/careers to learn about our awesome culture

listing.title: Web Developer
listing.description:
Tampa Bay based web development firm looking for a talented and motivated web developer to join our growing team. 

Qualified candidates will have at least 2 years of experience working with PHP, MySQL, HTML/CSS and intermediate JavaScript. Experienced in developing for WordPress ideal. Ability to breakdown client problems and develop from design to implementation. Ability to communicate well verbally and in writing with good time management skills. 

Specific Skills: 

• Experience with one or more backend technologies (PHP, WordPress, etc) 

• Good understanding of front-end technologies, including HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, jQuery. 

• Knowledge of change control systems, specifically Git, is required. 

• Local development server and knowledge of how to run websites locally required. 

• Knowledge of gulp / scss is required. 

• Knowledge of how to interact with RESTful APIs and formats (JSON, XML) a plus. 

• Knowledge of Cake PHP, a plus. 

 

Include portfolio and/or code samples with application.
listing.howto_apply: Include portfolio and/or code samples with application.

company.name: Eleven11 Group
company.tagline: Delivering world-class websites, software and mobile applications.

listing.title: Senior Designer
listing.description:
Overview

Life is too short to design for the status quo. It’s go time! Now is the time to make that move to an agency position that empowers you to own your creative and see it through to fruition. Vitamin is actively interviewing for a Senior Designer to join our growing team. We’re looking for someone who’s savvy, loves to create and relishes the next challenge. At Vitamin, we pride ourselves on the aesthetic value we bring to our clients and the delicate balance where form meets function. Our designs are equal parts memorable and effective. We empower our designers to leverage their complete talent sets by bringing a process that results in strong creative and swift client approvals. You will be a collaborative part of our team and will be involved in kick-off meetings and design presentations. You will have the opportunity to discuss and demonstrate the designs you’ve created (along with the support of a Creative Director, Art Director(s) and/or project manager.) We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and a unique client roster that spans a variety of industries to keep things fresh and challenging. The ideal candidate will have 3+ years experience in an agency or in-house setting.

Responsibilities

  • Conceptualize, execute and manage creative work that separates our clients from their competition
  • Ensure visual brand consistency that is congruent with each client’s unique messaging
  • Work as a part of a team and independently to create high quality client deliverables
  • Specific design assignments will include: web interfaces, brand and identity packages, sales collateral, advertising, full-scale campaigns, social media content, and more

Must-Haves

  • Extensive knowledge of the Adobe Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign) and Sketch
  • Passion for composition, hierarchy, and visual storytelling through design
  • Understanding and appreciation for typography
  • Experience with both print and interactive design
  • 3+ years professional experience
  • 4-year degree
  • Passion to learn and succeed; ability to take well to constructive criticism
  • Motivation to work individually and as a team in a fast-paced, client-centric business environment
  • Attention to detail along with the ability to self manage and follow directions

Nice-to-Haves

  • Prior agency experience
  • Experience designing for HubSpot, Marketo, other Marketing Automation platforms
  • Experience with eCommerce platforms such as WooCommerce, BigCommerce, Shopify, Magento
  • Experience with JavaScript HTML5 animation tools/techniques such as GreenSock
  • Experience with Principle
  • Familiarity with WordPress, HTML, CSS
  • Photography, retouching, and video editing experience
  • Ability to draw or illustrate
  • Ability to write creatively

Benefits

We all work to make money. And when you join the Vitamin team, you will be compensated well in exchange for the time and talent you are devoting to your career and to our success, as an agency. We also offer a comprehensive benefits package, inclusive of medical, dental and vision; 401(k) with employer match; 3-week vacation to start with escalation; Summer Fridays, Takeout Tuesday; Mental Health Days, and much more beyond those “standard” employment benefits. Some of the perks our team appreciates the most, and gets super excited about include:

  • Location: the opportunity to work in an exciting location, in office space that is warm, inviting, and inspiring. Our office is positioned just one short block from the Creative Alliance, which is buzzing weekly with new art exhibitions, dance and music performances, movie showings, poetry readings, educational programs and other events that will keep any creative person’s heart content.

  • Work Environment: Most days, we’ve got the music pumping. And while we work hard, we also realize taking breathers throughout the day is not only necessary, but also gives us the chance to build personal relationships with those we work with side-by side. Plus, we know these little breathers ultimately make us more productive.

  • Parking: It’s plentiful, and it’s free.

  • Daily Style: We believe comfort is key and encourage you to dress in a way that is polished and professional for meetings, and work-appropriate the rest of the time.

  • Coffee is Key: We know it, and you know it. If you’re a coffee aficionado like many of us, you’ll quickly join the daily grind at our QuickMill Anita espresso machine.

  • Lunchtime Options: We’re a quick hop, skip, or jump away from some pretty cool and eclectic hot spots, from Canton Square and Patterson Park to local favorites like Atwater’s, DiPasquale’s, Matthew’s Pizza, and Snake Hill Tavern. We love food!

  • Bragging Rights: We crank out award-winning work. And at the end of the day, when your name is on it, you can say you were part of making it all happen.

About Vitamin

Wondering what Vitamin is all about? We are a Baltimore-based agency, delivering deeply branded integrated marketing-communications solutions for clients who need and want to bring their unique differences to life digitally and beyond. Growing and evolving each and every day for more than 15 years, we manage only the best, most collaborative and high-performing client-agency relationships. We develop and deliver strategies, campaigns and programs that aren’t just out of the box; they’re nowhere near the box. They lead to trackable, measurable results that make us, as well as the clients we serve, extremely proud. That said, when the time comes for us to recruit new talent to join our tight-knit team, we are looking for the best of the best. It’s what we want and absolutely need, and it’s what our clients demand.
listing.howto_apply: Submit your resume, online portfolio (PDF and/or URL) and salary requirements to careers@vitaminisgood.com with the subject line: Senior Designer. No recruiters or freelancers, please.

company.name: Vitamin
company.tagline: The Cure for the Common Brand.

listing.title: Front-End Developer
listing.description:
Overview

Are you ready to work in a new environment? Let’s do this! Now is the time to make that move to an agency position that empowers you to own your work from start to finish, create great things and work on challenging digital projects. Here at Vitamin, we love WordPress. We love attention to detail. And we love bringing our designs to life with polished front-end code that is mobile-first, SEO-friendly, accessible, and light weight. Javascript skills? Check! PHP and MySQL skills? Check! Experience with JS animation libraries and JS frameworks? Now we’re talking. We enable our developers to leverage their complete talent sets by bringing a process that results in solid build work and strong creative. You will have direct access to clients and be involved in kick-off meetings and design presentations. We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and a unique client roster that spans a variety of industries to keep things fresh and challenging. The ideal candidate will have 2-5 years experience in an agency or in-house setting.

Must-Haves

  • Thorough knowledge of HTML, CSS, and Responsive design
  • Experience with Javascript and jQuery
  • A working knowledge of PHP, MySQL
  • Experience with WordPress – the more the better
  • 2-5 years professional experience
  • 4-year degree
  • Understanding of typography and the ability to utilize type effectively
  • Passion to learn and succeed; ability to take well to constructive criticism
  • Motivation to work individually and as a team in a fast-paced, client-centric business environment
  • Attention to detail along with the ability to self manage and follow directions

And while we work hard, we also realize taking breathers throughout the day is not only necessary, but also gives us the chance to build personal relationships with those we work with side-by side. Plus, we know these little breathers ultimately make us more productive.

  • Parking: It’s plentiful, and it’s free.

  • Daily Style: We believe comfort is key and encourage you to dress in a way that is polished and professional for meetings, and work-appropriate the rest of the time.

  • Coffee is Key: We know it, and you know it. If you’re a coffee aficionado like many of us, you’ll quickly join the daily grind at our QuickMill Anita espresso machine.

  • Lunchtime Options: We’re a quick hop, skip, or jump away from some pretty cool and eclectic hot spots, from Canton Square and Patterson Park to local favorites like Atwater’s, DiPasquale’s, Matthew’s Pizza, and Snake Hill Tavern. We love food!

  • Bragging Rights: We crank out award-winning work. And at the end of the day, when your name is on it, you can say you were part of making it all happen.

About Vitamin

Wondering what Vitamin is all about? We are a Baltimore-based agency, delivering deeply branded integrated marketing-communications solutions for clients who need and want to bring their unique differences to life digitally and beyond. Growing and evolving each and every day for more than 15 years, we manage only the best, most collaborative and high-performing client-agency relationships. We develop and deliver strategies, campaigns and programs that aren’t just out of the box; they’re nowhere near the box. They lead to trackable, measurable results that make us, as well as the clients we serve, extremely proud. That said, when the time comes for us to recruit new talent to join our tight-knit team, we are looking for the best of the best. It’s what we want and absolutely need, and it’s what our clients demand.

listing.title: User Experience Architect/Digital Strategist
listing.description:
Job Description

 

Job Title: User Experience Architect/Digital Strategist

Internal Job Title: Specialist II

Department: Marketing and Communications, Digital Department

Reports To: Digital Director

 

About CRS

Catholic Relief Services is the official international humanitarian agency of the Catholic community in the United States. CRS works to save, protect, and transform lives in need in more than 100 countries, without regard to race, religion or nationality. CRS' relief and development work is accomplished through programs of emergency response, HIV, health, agriculture, education, microfinance and peacebuilding.

 

Job Summary

Want to put your digital strategy and design expertise to work making the world a better place? Then Catholic Relief Services (CRS) is looking for you!

 

CRS is seeking a high-level digital strategist who can guide the digital efforts for CRS's brand, sub-brands and campaigns towards a unified online strategy that aligns with the agency's goals: building awareness among our varied audiences, deepening engagement with current supporters, and raising more money to support our life-saving work overseas. If you want to work collaboratively in a team environment while making the world a better place, we're looking for you.

 

Want in? You should be able to set the information architecture for sites of different sizes and levels of complexity; have an engaging, conversion-focused approach to front-end design; and have a comprehensive understanding of digital best practices and technologies, including search engine optimization, content development, content management systems, and analytics.

 

 

Roles and Key Responsibilities

You will lead internal CRS stakeholders through the discovery process; help create strategies that marry our business needs with our audiences' needs; document requirements; and create supporting assets (audience documentation, sitemaps, content briefs, wireframes, prototypes, etc.) that get stakeholders excited and help the developers (or vendors) execute efficiently. You should be a strategic, personable, results-oriented guide who can educate stakeholders about digital strategy and best practices and drive consensus around shared goals for engaging diverse audiences online. You will be supported by developers, designers, and content developers, but should be as comfortable talking about marketing and fundraising as they are functionality and features.

 

  • Work with internal stakeholders to identify their business goals and develop the strategies and tactics required to meet them
  • Analyze existing data to guide strategy and implementation of online tactics
  • Develop information architectures, page types, and wireframes
  • Work with designers and developers to prescribe front-end designs that align with existing digital platforms, other outreach efforts, and the agency's brand and content strategies
  • Consult on content creation for your stakeholders, e.g., landing page content, ad copy, social media content
  • Review requirements so everyone is on the same page before the build
  • Own the stakeholder's vision for the end deliverable: after QA, you'll approve when a deliverable is it up to quality standards
  • Design, build and maintain a master Sketch template of all CRS's UX/UI contents, including typography, color, iconography, buttons, forms, responsive components, tiles, and navigation elements
  • Assist in the maintenance of CRS style guides
  • Participate in industry-related development groups and communities to create optimal opportunities for learning resources and knowledge sharing
  • Work collaboratively in a fun team environment to generate new ideas, improved efficiencies and share knowledge
  • Mentor, support, and coach colleagues to keep staff up to date on online best practices

 

Agency-Wide Competencies

These are rooted in the mission, values, and guiding principles of CRS and used by each staff member to fulfill his or her responsibilities and achieve the desired results.

  • Integrity
  • Accountability & Stewardship
  • Builds Relationships
  • Develops Talent
  • Continuous Improvement & Innovation
  • Strategic Mindset

 

Qualifications

  • Four to six years of digital strategy, online marketing/fundraising/advocacy, or agency experience
  • Strong knowledge of user experience design, including ability to create sitemaps and wireframes
  • Strong working knowledge of Photoshop, Illustrator, InVision, and Sketch
  • Working knowledge of AfterEffect, WebFlow, Adobe XD a plus
  • A working knowledge of HTML and CSS, preferably HTLM 5 and CSS 3
  • A working knowledge of JavaScript
  • Comfortable designing to a grid and mobile-first design principles
  • Strong conceptualization, verbal and visual communication ability
  • Ability to communicate effectively with back-end developers to convey stakeholder needs
  • Experience with online tools such as Drupal, WordPress, EveryAction/NP VAN, Google Analytics, tracking software such as HotJar, CrazyEgg, etc.
  • Ability to inspire and advise peers and senior colleagues on multiple teams, set and review goals, assess risks and outcomes, and analyze data
  • Experience creating clear, detailed documentation of needs, requirements, and priorities
  • Exposure to paid advertising, social media, email outreach best practices
  • A willingness to try new tactics across all digital channels --ideas you've dreamed up, or something interesting you saw from another campaign
  • Ability to interface with stakeholders across multiple departments with varying skillsets
  • Good communication skills -- you can interpret results for stakeholders, explain strategic decisions and maintain smooth relationships
  • Spanish speaking a plus

 

Key Working Relationships

Internal: Creative services, communications, domestic outreach, charitable giving/fundraising, advocacy, overseas operations

External: Vendors and consultants

 

Supervisory Responsibilities: None

What we offer

CRS offers a comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, life insurance, vision, generous retirement savings plan and the opportunity to work in a collaborative, mission-driven culture that is committed to improving the lives of the poor throughout the world.

 

***Our Catholic identity is at the heart of our mission and operations. Catholic Relief Services carries out the commitment of the Bishops of the United States to assist the poor and vulnerable overseas. We welcome as a part of our staff people of all faiths and secular traditions who share our values and our commitment to serving those in need. CRS' processes and policies reflect our commitment to protecting children and vulnerable adults from abuse and exploitation.

 

Disclaimer Clause

This job description is not an exhaustive list of the skill, effort, duties, and responsibilities associated with the position.

 

Note: All candidates must be eligible to work in the US at the time of application.

 

Internal applicants are encouraged to apply within the first 10 days of posting.

 

EOE/M/F/D/V - CRS is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

listing.title: Front-End, UI/UX Website Developer (In-house)
listing.description:
Front-End, UI/UX Website Developer: Full Time (In-house)
We are looking for an experienced and proven Front-End, UI/UX Website Developer that will be responsible for front-end development and maintenance of high-profile, consumer-facing websites. This individual will have the opportunity to lead and develop high-level creative initiatives across the agency's diverse portfolio. 

This position will be responsible for the front-end development of websites and digital products from initial concept, all the way to completion, covering the entire website layout and function. This position is also responsible for maintaining and improving existing websites as content is updated and current user data is analyzed.

Responsibilities, Skills and Qualifications:

  •        Create and maintain reusable, efficient and well-documented code using best HTML5/CSS/SASS practices.
  •       Strong proficiency in JavaScript.
  •        Familiar with MySQL, PHP5 and API Integration
  •        Familiar with code versioning tools (eg. GIT)
  •        Ensure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs
  •        Strong proficiency with responsive development
  •        Proficient understanding of cross-browser compatibility issues and ways to work around them
  •        Good understanding of SEO principles and ensuring that applications will adhere to them
  •        Optimize application for maximum speed and scalability
  •        Proficient in Adobe Illustrator/Photoshop and Sketch. Familiarity with InVision prototypes and Studio is a plus  
  •        Basic knowledge of image authoring tools, to be able to crop, resize, or perform small adjustments on an image.
  •        Assure that all user input is validated before submitting to back-end
  •        Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders
  •        Ability to take direction, prioritize tasks and handle high volume demands
  •        Comfortable in a fast-paced, high-intensity work environment with strict deadlines

Requirements:

  • Bachelorâ€™s Degree in Graphic Design, Web Design and Development, Advertising, Fine Arts or related field
  • Must have 5-7 years of qualified experience
  • Familiarity with Adobe Creative Suite
  • Experience working collaboratively with creative directors, designers and copywriters to build great user and brand experiences
  • Must provide a link to an online portfolio that includes a range of web related projects

Perks and Benefits:

  • Great team and work environment
  • Competitive compensation
  • High Profile Fortune 500 clients

*Please refrain from contacting our offices directly, we will review every candidate and respond to those qualified in a timely manner.

listing.title: WordPress Developer
listing.description:
Who We Are:

 

Since 2000 Guildhouse Group has carefully crafted communication tools and business assets. Our focus has always remained the same: create audience-focused design solutions for our clients. 

 

Our office is in Walla Walla, WA, but we work remotely with many people throughout the country, and the world. This position will reside in Walla Walla. It's a fun, fast-paced but casual work environment. We're looking for a WordPress developer to join our team.If you are passionate about creating amazing work and becoming part of a dynamic, team-oriented group of people, please read on!

 

 

Key Responsibilities:

  • Develop new WordPress websites
  • Maintain and optimize current websites
  • Ensure functionality across browsers, operating systems, and devices
  • Develop A/B and multivariate test webpages, forms, email campaigns, etc.
  • Review site analytics to optimize sites for lead generation
  • Implement tracking and testing of sites
  • Monitor and troubleshoot security issues, plugin issues, and theme conflicts

 

Qualifications:

  • Minimum 3 years successful professional WordPress and web standards-based development experience
  • In-depth knowledge of WordPress, themes and plugins
  • Expert knowledge of standards-compliant HTML5 & CSS2/3, JavaScript (esp. jQuery and Responsive (RWD) techniques and methods
  • Experience with Progressive JavaScript frameworks (Vue, React, etc.)
  • Proficiency with Photshop, Sketch and/or Figma
  • Experience with front-end development frameworks (e.g. Twitter Bootstrap)
  • Experience with API integration
  • Experience with version control workflows and tools (preferably Git)
  • Ability to manage the development of each assigned project, and perform tests on multiple platforms
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Self-starter who can work independently and take full ownership of each project
  • Able to work in a team environment on specific projects, providing input and skills as needed
  • Demonstrated ability to deliver projects on time and within budget
  • Solutions-oriented
  • Ability to think critically and develop creative solutions
  • Handle multiple projects at once; multitasking when necessary
  • Thrive in a fast-paced environment

 

Benefits:

  • Competitive salary
  • Subsidized medical 
  • insurance
  • Life insurance
  • 401K with company matching
  • Generous PTO package

company.name: Guildhouse Group
company.tagline: Creating audience-focused design solutions for our clients

listing.title: PHP / WordPress Developer
listing.description:
Summary

ParkChirp is a web-based parking platform designed to bring enhanced services and features to online purchasers of parking in garages and lots in major US cities. The solution was developed and is owned by commercial real estate professionals with deep parking industry experience and strong national client relationships. The application was launched in 2017.

The company’s product offering is an online parking sales site (www.parkchirp.com) with enhanced features and functionality at a dramatically lower cost compared to current solutions. The initial rollout has been well received and sales have exceeded sales and adoption projections. The company is growing its team and seeks an experienced and skilled developer to develop an expanded product offering and additional features.

Required skills

  • Experience with Wordpress
  • 2+ years of experience with object-oriented PHP7, Gilt and MySQL
  • Mobile web experience
  • Strong knowledge of Javascript (ES6+)
  • Strong written and spoken English communication skills

Responsibilities

  • Work with the technology and business teams to design and implement a new product offering ParkChirp.com
  • Interact with current front and back end developers
  • Participate in regular standups
  • Comfortable wearing many hats and willing to work on all parts of the stack
  • You love moving fast and working on complex problems in a niche market with a highly engaged team

Work Environment

  • The company is located in the River North area of Chicago, IL
  • Our team is young, dynamic and extremely engaged in the day-to-day business and new product development

company.name: Hopp Parking, LLC
company.tagline: ParkChirp is a web-based parking platform that sells parking online.

listing.title: Front End Developer
listing.description:
We're on the hunt for an experienced developer who is passionate about building fast, accessible, modular and responsive websites--whether that's using HTML, CSS or JavaScript. We're searching for a bright, energetic person to join us and work with our creative and development teams to bring complex websites to life—all while being mindful of the latest development trends and keeping both the client’s goals and the end user in mind.

Here’s a snapshot (but not all) of your technical responsibilities:

We assume that a person with your experience has handled a website launch or two in your life, but just to clarify, here are some things we keep in mind when reviewing your application:

  • Ample experience. What does this mean? While we won’t put a requirement on the amount of years, we do want to see your portfolio of web work. We also want to know that you’re familiar with the tools and thinking we apply to our work:
    • HTML, CSS, JavaScript and PHP
    • Front-end patterns, such as BEM, Atomic Design and object-oriented CSS
      Frameworks, such as React and Vue.js
    • Templating tools, such as Twig, JSX and Handlebars
    • Module bundlers, such as Webpack, Browserify or Parcel
    • PHP-based CMS platforms, such as Craft, ExpressionEngine and Wordpress
    • Git and GitHub
  • Get with the program. While our solid team of UI/UX designers design things that people will gush over, the more you have a basic understanding of Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator and/or Sketch, the better. From time to time, we might ask you to provide technical insight to our web team.
  • Nerd out with data and process. Know how to scale websites as they increase in traffic and complexity, and understand the importance of progressive enhancement and graceful degradation.
  • Be a catalyst. Be vigilant about web standards, performance, accessibility and usability by researching and providing recommendations on services/technologies for various projects. We’ll also want you to be cognizant of site performance and speed, including best practices for reducing HTTP requests, browser repaints and mobile overhead.
  • Juggling master. You should be able to handle multiple projects and deadlines while also being focused enough to remain committed to those that span multiple months.
  • Stunning interactions. You should be able to show how you think in development as it relates to UI/UX. Show us what you’ve been working on!
  • Troubleshooting skills. Yeah, we want you to be able to figure it out, whatever “it” is.
  • Taste matters. Our clients come to us because we care about making them look amazing in their customers' eyes. Show us that you know what people like.
  • Start to finish. You can go from brainstorming with the team to delivering thoughtful mock-ups for all digital platforms. You can see a project through to completion, no matter what obstacles stand in your way. Stick to budget. Not only are you wise with our clients’ money, you also know how to accurately quote your work.
  • Don’t procrastinate. Initiate. You know how to suggest and spearhead development. Here, your ideas matter. We expect you to put them into action when you see an unfulfilled need.
  • Play on a team. Participate in internal meetings on behalf of client accounts—and be willing to jump into the fray when help is needed. We expect you to follow our standards while working in the pipeline with other team members, including the UI/UX team.

If you have a great personality, enjoy cracking difficult problems and are an all-around team superstar, you’ll go far with our agency. Join us!

Here’s what you’ll need:

  • At least three years of professional, post-collegiate experience
  • A B.S., B.F.A. or equivalent work experience
  • Must be a U.S. resident.

To apply:

If you’re interested in this job, please apply below. Give us a little bit of time to look over your materials — please note that calling us up will not improve your chances. If we think you might be a good fit for TrendyMinds, we’ll reach out to you!
listing.perks: We offer 18 paid vacation days, 10 company holidays, 401k matching. We cover 100% of health insurance premiums for all team members and 50% for their spouses and dependents. We offer phenomenal facilities, flexible schedules and much more!

company.name: TrendyMinds
company.tagline: We're boundary pushers, big thinkers and difference makers.

listing.title: Senior Web and Application Developer
listing.description:
Harvard University - Harvard T.H. Chan School of Public Health


Senior Web and Application Developer
48658BR


Job Summary

Independently perform complex applications/web development for projects of large to very large size and complexity; typically work as part of a team to implement business solutions. Responsible for all aspects of application development cycle. Code advanced and complex software solutions.

Core Duties

  • Participate fully in software development life cycle
  • Implement and support technical solutions to deliver business requirements
  • Identify and evaluate opportunities to improve services
  • Contribute ideas to coding best practices and new technologies
  • Draw on relationship and technical skills to act as technical liaison to internal and external clients
  • Abide by and follow the Harvard University IT technical standards, policies and Code of Conduct



Basic Qualifications

  • Minimum of two years' post-secondary education and/or relevant work experience


Additional Qualifications

  • Minimum two years' additional post-secondary education and/or relevant work experience
  • Knowledge of information technology applications, processes, software and equipment
  • Demonstrated team performance skills, service mindset approach, and the ability to act as a trusted advisor
  • Bachelor's degree preferred
  • 3+ years of open source programming experience preferred
  • Experience building web applications in a LAMP environment preferred
  • Experience with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, and relational database design in MySQL or SQL Server preferred
  • Demonstrated knowledge of WordPress; experience with WordPress Core as well as plugins and themes development; WordPress multi-site experience preferred
  • Experience with third-party APIs and REST web services (Google, Facebook, Twitter) preferred
  • Mobile first responsive design experience, as well as Amazon Web Services (AWS) experience, preferred

Interest in learning additional programming languages; exposure to agile software development (Kanban); web and database server administration experience; experience with GIT, versioning software, bug tracking; familiarity with digital signage platforms, streaming media protocols, and digital video asset management systems such as Kaltura; experience with bug tracking, ticketing, and other administrative systems; excellent communication skills -- written, verbal, and presentations; understanding of web standards and best practices; interest in education and promoting public health initiatives; experience effectively explaining issues and solutions to non-technical audiences; excellent collaborative skills with other IT professionals (e.g., server administrators, security manager) preferred
Working Conditions

  • Work is performed in an office setting


Additional Information

The Harvard T.H. Chan of Public Health is dedicated to building a diverse community of individuals who are committed to contributing to an inclusive environment - including fostering respect for all, serving the greater good, and welcoming individuals from diverse backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. To learn more about the Chan School's mission, objectives, and core values, please visit our website here.

Harvard offers an outstanding benefits package including:

Time Off: 3- 4 weeks paid vacation, paid holiday break, 12 paid sick days, 11.5 paid holidays, and 3 paid personal days per year.
Medical/Dental/Vision: We offer a variety of excellent medical plans, dental & vision plans, all coverage begins as of your start date.
Retirement: University-funded retirement plan with full vesting after 3 years of service.
Tuition Assistance Program: Competitive tuition assistance program, $40 per class at the Harvard Extension School and discounted options through participating Harvard grad schools.
Transportation: Harvard offers a 50% discounted MBTA pass as well as additional options to assist employees in their daily commute.
Wellness Options: Harvard offers programs and classes at little or no cost, including stress management, massages, nutrition, meditation and complimentary health services.
Harvard access to athletic facilities, libraries, campus events and many discounts throughout metro Boston.

Join the Harvard T.H. Chan School of Public Health to support our mission of health research and education, and to be a part of the oldest institution of higher learning in the country!

Job Function
Information Technology

Location
USA - MA - Boston

Department
Information Technology

Time Status
Full-time

Union
00 - Non Union, Exempt or Temporary

Salary Grade
057

Pre-Employment Screening
Criminal, Education, Identity

EEO Statement
We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation, pregnancy and pregnancy-related conditions, or any other characteristic protected by law.





Apply Here

company.name: Harvard T.H. Chan School of Public Health

listing.title: Identity and Access Management Team Lead
listing.description:
The University of Wisconsin-Madison’s Division of Information Technology (DoIT) is looking for a technical team lead to join our dynamic, growing team. DoIT supports teaching and learning at UW-Madison by providing innovative, user-centered, reliable technology solutions.

The Identity and Access Management (IAM) Team acquires, develops, and maintains identity and access systems, products, and tools for the entire University of Wisconsin (UW) System and, more specifically, UW-Madison. This includes designing, planning, developing, operating, and constantly improving our use and implementation of technology.

Your Role:

The work we do is varied and challenging, so you will need the tenacity to take on a variety of projects that benefit students, faculty, and staff at UW-Madison and beyond. As a Technical Team Lead, you will have the opportunity to put your technical and leadership skills to work with our team and partners. A big part of being successful will be establishing an advisory presence across technical domains and facilitating decision making and planning. You will also have the opportunity to help usher in industry leading solutions as we begin our Interoperability Transformation Initiative (https://it.wisc.edu/it-projects/interoperability-initiative/).

Who are we looking for?

We are looking for someone who is a practiced technologist who is also interested in leadership or developing skills to prepare for an architect level position. To be successful, you’ll need excellent communication skills to help represent the important work we do to technical and non-technical audiences. Additionally, customer service skills and an eye for operational excellence are a must since you’ll work with our partners to implement technical solutions. You should have knowledge of modern best practices in system administration/security and have worked with at least one contemporary programming language (Java, Python, Ruby, .NET, etc.). Experience with modern iterative team practices like DevOps or Agile are a plus.

UW-Madison is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer.  We believe that we are better able to serve our diverse set of campus customers through supporting the unique backgrounds and perspectives of our staff. We encourage all qualified individuals to apply. 

Deadline to apply: April 28, 2019

 

For more information, or to apply, got to: https://go.wisc.edu/75j95n

company.name: Division of Information Technology-UW Madison, WI
company.tagline: Your work can support tens of thousands of students and staff.

listing.title: Advisory Services Senior - Digital - Philadelphia Design Studio - Senior UX Engineer
listing.description:
Today’s companies are experiencing unprecedented digital growth as digital-physical systems, powered by Internet of Things and fuelled by data, create a fully interconnected society. Increasing customer demands require companies to create a seamless experience across all channels. It’s an increasingly complex, digitized, fast-changing and interconnected world and as part of the Digital practice, you’ll help leading companies across industries strategize and execute on their future vision and experience.

 


 

At the EY Design Studio, our team of designers, researchers, technologists and strategists work together to create superior apps, websites and software. We approach projects with the insight and perspective that come with years of experience in user-centered design and development. We specialize in creating superior experiences that are supported by research, brand strategy, and a clear understanding of business and user needs.


 


The opportunity

We’re looking for a Senior UX Engineer who thrives in a fast-paced environment and can collaborate with our designers, researchers and strategists to create superior user experiences.



Your key responsibilities

• Create experiences that come to life on digital devices

• Utilize user-centered design methodologies

• Implement designs with other technologists and technology organizations

• Build and testing user interfaces to our or our clients’ specifications


 

Skills and attributes for success

Aside from the world-class user experience design we deliver to leading companies, what makes us unique is our fun, transparent, highly entrepreneurial and collaborative culture. We work hard, play hard, and love what we do together. Day in and day out, we know we can count on one another.


 

To qualify for the role you must have

• Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or other related field

• A minimum of 2 years’ experience in technology or a similar role

• Working knowledge of JavaScript frameworks such as Angular, React, React Native or Vue

• Experience writing accessible, responsive code that performs across browsers and native devices

• Experience with Photoshop or Sketch


 

Ideally, you’ll also have

• Knowledge of building end to end systems using Node.js is a plus

• Interest in building native mobile applications for Android and iOS using Objective-C, Swift, React Native or Java for Android

• Sass/SCSS/CSS precompiler experience preferred

• Passionate about understanding current and emerging UX trends

• Ability to multitask and work in a fast-paced, collaborative team environment

• Openness to occasional local or national travel

• Excellent written and oral communication skills; writing, publishing and conference-level presentation skills a plus


 

What working at EY offers

We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. In addition, our Total Rewards package includes medical and dental coverage, both pension and 401(k) plans, a minimum of 15 days of vacation plus ten observed holidays and three paid personal days, and a range of programs and benefits designed to support your physical, financial and social well-being. Plus, we offer:

• The opportunity to manage a portfolio of talent within a designated service line

• A collaborative environment where everyone works together to create a better working world

• Excellent training and development prospects, both through established programs and on-the-job training

• An excellent team of senior colleagues, dedicated to managing and varying your workload

 


 

About EY

As a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services, we hire and develop the most passionate people in their field to help build a better working world. This starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. So that whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime. 

 

Make your mark. If you think everything we’ve said so far sounds great, then we look forward to hearing from you!

 

 

 

 

EY, an equal employment opportunity employer (Females/Minorities/Protected Veterans/Disabled), values the diversity of our workforce and the knowledge of our people.

 

 

.

listing.title: Front-End Web Developer
listing.description:
I See Me! is looking for a qualified Front-End Developer to join our team and build the client-side of our web applications, translating our company and customer needs into functional and appealing interactive applications. You will be responsible for understanding shopping behavior on our website, improving the user experience, recommending new technologies and updating the site with our ongoing promotions and new products, and leading the effort to develop international versions of our site as we expand internationally.

 

In this role you will employ knowledge of ecommerce technology to enhance the site with new functionality, execute A/B testing to improve the user experience, regularly monitor Google Analytics metrics to understand consumer behavior on our website, optimize the site for SEO, work with Marketing and Design to add new products, update promotions, prices and product information and aid in creating versions of our website for different countries.

 

You should have a minimum of 5 years related experience along with HTML, CSS, Javascript, jQuery, basic PHP and content management proficiency, demonstrated knowledge of browser and platform capability, multi-device user interface skills, SEO and responsive web architecture familiarity as well as basic image authoring abilities. Cross functional team experience, strategic skills in identifying trends and opportunities for website enhancement and strong communication skills are key to this role. Experience with the Magento ecommerce platform, UX design processes, site analytics implementation and multivariate testing will be a plus!

 

Must be located in the Twin Cities area to apply. Position offers flexibility to work in the office 2 days a week and from home 3 days a week.

 

 

 

I See Me! is the leader in the personalized book market, with millions of copies sold through its website www.iseeme.com and high-end retailers. The company has developed an extensive line of award-winning personalized books and gifts that celebrate the uniqueness of each child and make keepsake gifts. The New York Times, Wall Street Journal, People Magazine and other media have given I See Me! accolades for its very high quality, unique personalized books, and the company has developed an A-list celebrity fan base that includes Brooke Shields, Courteney Cox, Rachel Zoe and Jessica Alba. With a customer base in the hundreds of thousands, I See Me! has continued to expand sales by developing personalized puzzles, coloring books, growth charts and other personalized products that feature the colorful and distinctive art from their beautiful books. I See Me! is owned by the McEvoy Group, which owns 4 publishing companies, including Chronicle Books, which is one of America’s most respected independent trade publishers.

listing.title: Senior Software Developer
listing.description:
About Solvent

Solvent is a new startup that provides safe payment options to consumers and a risk platform for banks that combats money-laundering, fraud and identity theft before it happens. We build integrated technologies that stand between traditional banking, merchants and customers that grant transparency to transactions to reduce the risk of money laundering, fraud, and identity theft.

We are looking for motivated senior PHP/Python engineers that have a background in enterprise level application development that can create elegant solutions to complex problems. This position will work collaboratively with the product team consisting of senior level product managers, UX designers and other senior engineers. Must be a team player and have extremely high communication skills.

Position Responsibilities

  • Experience in product architecture, strategy, test and documentation of enterprise level technology
  • Able to understand complex problems quickly and offer feedback to product team
  • Experience working remotely and willing to travel to Annapolis, MD for occasional planning sessions
  • Maintain high quality standards and reducing ongoing technical debt
  • Support planning and feature estimates during roadmapping and sprint planning 

Skills Requirements

  • Senior experience in building custom PHP/Python applications
  • Senior experience in SQL and NoSql database design, indexing and performance
  • Senior experience in designing and implementing REST API
  • Experience working in a complex AWS server environment
  • Experience in private blockchain development
  • High Proficiency in PHP & Python frameworks
  • Ability to write clear and well documented code
  • Consider yourself an amazing communicator
  • Independent work ethic and ability to play nice with others on your team
  • Experience working in machine learning environments i.e. MATLAB

The Team

We are a tight group of entrepreneurs and VC's all over the U.S. with a headquarters in beautiful downtown Annapolis, MD.  We believe in personal development and growth actively stressing education and internal collaboration. Fitting our culture is equally as important as fitting our job requirements. Communication is the key to the success of our company and is a cornerstone for producing great work. Take pride in what you do!

Benefits

This is a full-time position, starting with a 3 month contract period that transitions to long term hire if interested. We offer competitive salary and bonus incentives as the product hits key milestones. You are getting in on the ground floor and will be key in defining benefit packages and share incentive plans long term.

Application

Please describe why you are an ideal candidate for this position and your salary requirements along with a link to your Github repo, Linkedin profile and resume. 

Thanks and good luck in your journey!
listing.perks:
- Competitive Salary
- Bonus Incentives 
- Paid Trips to Annapolis & Conferences
- Fun & Challenging Product
- Ground Floor with New Startup

listing.title: Senior Front End Developer
listing.description:
Who We Are

At Outside Analytics we are passionate about the outdoors and building software that increases outdoor accessibility, usage, and understanding. We are building a data analytics and geospatial processing platform with an innovative web and mobile interface to empower people's outdoor experiences. We believe that the right technology can create stronger connections between people and nature, improve health and wellness, increase environmental empathy, and drive support for public land conservation.

Position Responsibilities

Development, test and deployment of complex and highly performant web applications. Assist in the development of strategic and technology roadmaps, and support the development of mobile applications.

Required Qualifications and Skills

  • Passionate about the outdoors and outdoor recreation
  • Expertise in React, Node, JavaScript, HTML, CSS
  • Proficiency working with mapping libraries and APIs such as Mapbox or Google Maps
  • API development and data driven RESTful web services
  • Performant querying of backend data stores such as SQL databases and Elasticsearch
  • Experience developing and deploying into Amazon Web Services (AWS)
  • DevOps practices and development tool chains (Github, Jenkins, Chef, etc)
  • Interpersonal skills, taking accountability for objectives, working with minimal oversight

Additional Qualifications and Skills

  • Mobile development (iOS, Android, React Native)
  • Experience with 3D mapping technology (Cesium, Google Earth, etc.)
  • Familiarity with data science

Education and Training Required

  • 4 year college (Bachelor’s Degree) or higher. Computer Science degree preferred.

Minimum Years of Experience

  • 4+ years of real world experience developing proven applications and systems.

Location

  • Boulder, Colorado

Other

  • Must be US Citizen

listing.title: Senior Software Developer
listing.description:

This individual will be expected to understand complex problems and be able to think critically about solutions to help deliver an excellent, quality product. This position will work collaboratively with the IT Team in researching, architecting, developing, and testing leading edge technology solutions.   Position Responsibilities:

  • Knows how to architect, implement, test, and document all components of a project

Credentials and Experience:

  Benefits of working for the National Inventors Hall of Fame include:

listing.title: Senior Developer
listing.description:
DEPARTMENT OVERVIEW

FRONTLINE is PBS’s flagship investigative documentary series, which explores the issues of our time through powerful storytelling. Our investigations have helped breathe new life into terrorism cold cases, freed innocent people from jail, prompted U.N. resolutions, and spurred both policy and social change. We’ve won every major journalism and broadcasting award, including 89 Emmy Awards and 20 Peabody Awards. Today, our dedicated cadre of reporters, producers and digital makers report across platforms — from our documentaries and podcast series, to longform written narratives and transmedia projects. In an age of 24/7 breaking news, we remain dedicated to thoughtful, incisive accountability journalism. 

 

FRONTLINE is also committed to presenting more voices, perspectives and experiences across our platforms. To foster a work environment that values inclusiveness and reflects the broad perspectives of the American public, we encourage qualified applicants from all racial, ethnic, religious and socioeconomic backgrounds, sexual orientations, gender identities and functional limitations to apply, especially those from historically marginalized communities. 

 

JOB OVERVIEW

FRONTLINE is looking for a creative, talented front-end developer to join its award-winning digital team. We’re seeking someone committed to telling deeply reported stories in an innovative, digital-first experience. We are story-first, so our developer will be involved from the outset in helping to create an experience that not only meets the project's needs technically, but also journalistically.  

 

Our work requires a nimble approach to development that involves staying up-to-date with the latest trends, and introducing emerging technologies into the tech stack to complement a fast-paced news environment. This person should be able to juggle short and long-term interactive projects on an evolving timeline, and be flexible enough to troubleshoot solutions on the fly.  

 

The ideal candidate will be comfortable with WordPress development, and a modern front-end Javascript framework, among others. They should be self-motivated, thrive in a collaborative culture, and committed to fair and rigorous journalism.   

RESPONSIBILITIES 

  • Work closely with FRONTLINE’s senior designer, reporters, producers and editors to create innovative digital projects 
  • Build internal tools that contribute to FRONTLINE’s award-winning reporting Evaluate third-party tools and libraries to determine how effectively they can serve digital reporting efforts
